column4: Looks like you need to specifically uninstall the debian versions first, then install the proper versions
yes, but removing mono-common will cause apt to remove ubuntu-desktop and a lot of other packages
Ahhh, I see, try your luck with apt-get install --reinstall mono
Also, if you can temporarily change the language to English, then me and some others can understand the error messages -- that would help. x.x
how to change it temporarily? :)
Something like: sudo sh -c 'LANG=en_US apt-get install --reinstall mono'
okay: http://phpfi.com/190702
further ideas?
Try using the same command I gave but mono-common and mono-jit instead of mono
gets me Reinstallation of mono-common is not possible, it cannot be downloaded., same with -jit
Try all three packages again but add --fix-broken
--fix-broken doesnt help
still the "it cannot be downloaded"-error
That doesn't sound like the same error. o.o
as i said before: "<kritzstapf> Ferret, gets me Reinstallation of mono-common is not possible, it cannot be downloaded., same with -jit"
That's not quite the same error message as the original, can you pastebin the command output that gives you that please?
yep http://phpfi.com/190708
Aha, ah yes... it can't find the versions you have installed, 'cos they're silly versions.  Let's see...
youve got it ;)
How about changing the command to install mono-1.1.17.1-1ubuntu7.1 specifically?  I dunno if apt lets you specify version exactly like that, but we can try it
jrib: http://phpfi.com/190709
Hrrrm.  That's a bit annoying.
a bit..
